page.title: 17A HOUSEWIFE'S DAY 1985
page.content: 7.30 a.m. Children and husband up. Breakfast. Children to school by 9 a.m. days tasks now begin :- tidying, washing up, vaccuam cleaning , baking, ironing, operating automatic washing machine. Pets fed, gerdening and mending done. Part-time employment outside home. Coffee break 10.30 a.m. lunch (a snack) at 1 p.m. Before picking up youngest child from school at 3 p.m. shopping in the village or the nearby town. Eldest child walks home at 3.30 p.m. and children play before tea eaten watching T.V. childrens programmes. Then they leave for leisure activities- Brownies Swimming etc. Children to bed, preparation of meal for husband and me. Evening leisure activities television or village organisations or evening out with husband using baby- sitter. Bed at 11p.m.{Linda Rutter
